customer_addr:
272 S Decatur Blvd
Las Vegas, NV 89107

citations.narrative:
There were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at the time of inspection for birds. Complete
and accurate animal records must be kept current to facilitate identification and tracking of animals as well as ensure their
health and well-being. Records must be maintained which fully and correctly disclose all the required information
concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise
disposed of and shall include any offspring born or hatched while in the licensee’s possession.
Correct by 01/31/2024.

There were two open bags of animal food and an open bag of bedding material in the backroom storage area. Open food
and bedding supplies stored in these areas attracts vermin or other pests which may transmit disease and contaminate
the food. Supplies of food and bedding must be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against
deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin to ensure the health and well-being of all the animals. A system of food
and bedding storage which adequately protects these supplies must be in place.
Correct by 01/31/2024.

The facility’s backroom used to store animal food, bedding and other supplies is in need of general housekeeping and
cleaning. There was an accumulation of bedding debris, discarded materials and loose miscellaneous items along several
areas of the floorspace. Regular cleaning/housekeeping is necessary to prevent the harborage of pests and to reduce the
potential for spread of disease. The premises must be kept clean and in good repair in order to facilitate the required
husbandry practices and to protect the health of the animals.
Correct by 01/31/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at the time of inspection for birds. Complete 
and accurate animal records must be kept current to facilitate identification and tracking of animals as well as ensure their 
health and well-being. Records must be maintained which fully and correctly disclose all the required information 
concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise 
disposed of and shall include any offspring born or hatched while in the licensee’s possession. 
 
Correct by 01/31/2024. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
There were two open bags of animal food and an open bag of bedding material in the backroom storage area. Open food 
and bedding supplies stored in these areas attracts vermin or other pests which may transmit disease and contaminate 
the food. Supplies of food and bedding must be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against 
deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin to ensure the health and well-being of all the animals. A system of food 
and bedding storage which adequately protects these supplies must be in place. 
 
Correct by 01/31/2024. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The facility’s backroom used to store animal food, bedding and other supplies is in need of general housekeeping and 
cleaning. There was an accumulation of bedding debris, discarded materials and loose miscellaneous items along several 
areas of the floorspace. Regular cleaning/housekeeping is necessary to prevent the harborage of pests and to reduce the 
potential for spread of disease. The premises must be kept clean and in good repair in order to facilitate the required 
husbandry practices and to protect the health of the animals. 
 
Correct by 01/31/2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
